body:
```
ASR verify pass error: ASR verify: Var::m_v `rad` cannot point outside of its symbol table
   --> /home/pranavchiku/scipy/scipy/interpolate/fitpack/fppola.f:1:7 - 537:10
    |
  1 |          recursive subroutine fppola(iopt1,iopt2,iopt3,m,u,v,z,w,rad,s,
    |          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^...
...
    |
537 |          end
    | ...^^^^^^^^^^ failed here

```

rename.from: [SciPy] ASR verify: Var::m_v `mess` cannot point outside of its symbol table
rename.to: [SciPy] ASR verify: Var::m_v 'mess' cannot point outside of its symbol table

body:
Okay so, I investigated a bit and observed an interesting thing, 
1) On declaring `SUBROUTINE XERROR(MESS,NMESS,L1,L2)` as `SUBROUTINE XERROR(NMESS,L1,L2)` compiles to ASR.
2) On not declaring `CHARACTER*(*) MESS` explicitly, generates ASR.

According to me, it's because of a bug in `--implicit-typing`. We will have to figure it out.

Hello @Pranavchiku, were you able to figure out the cause for this issue? I'm facing a similar issue for FunctionCall in Compiling FPM as well.
```py
ASR verify pass error: ASR verify: FunctionCall::m_name `len_trim` cannot point outside of its symbol table
 --> build/dependencies/M_CLI2/src/M_CLI2.F90:1:1
  |
1 | !VERSION 1.0 20200115
  | ^ failed here


Note: if any of the above error or warning messages are not clear or are lacking
context please report it to us (we consider that a bug that needs to be fixed).
```
Not yet, sorry. I will look today again.

Why is `mess` represented as a `Function` here? 
What does 
```
                    xerror 
                    [mess] 
 ```
represents in ASR.
>ASR 

```
(TranslationUnit 
    (SymbolTable
        1
        {
            xerror:
                (Function 
                    (SymbolTable
                        2
                        {
                            mess:
                                (Function 
                                    (SymbolTable
                                        3
                                        {
                                            mess_arg_0:
                                                (Variable 
                                                    3 
                                                    mess_arg_0 
                                                    [] 
                                                    Unspecified 
                                                    () 
                                                    () 
                                                    Default 
                                                    (Integer 4 []) 
                                                    BindC 
                                                    Public 
                                                    Required 
                                                    .false.
                                                ), 
                                            mess_return_var_name:
                                                (Variable 
                                                    3 
                                                    mess_return_var_name 
                                                    [] 
                                                    ReturnVar 
                                                    () 
                                                    () 
                                                    Default 
                                                    (Real 8 []) 
                                                    BindC 
                                                    Public 
                                                    Required 
                                                    .false.
                                                )
                                            
                                        }) 
                                    mess 
                                    [] 
                                    [(Var 3 mess_arg_0)] 
                                    [] 
                                    (Var 3 mess_return_var_name) 
                                    BindC 
                                    Public 
                                    Interface 
                                    () 
                                    .false. 
                                    .false. 
                                    .false. 
                                    .false. 
                                    .false. 
                                    [] 
                                    [] 
                                    .false.
                                )
                            
                        }) 
                    xerror 
                    [mess] 
                    [(Var 2 mess)] 
                    [(Print 
                        () 
                        [(FunctionCall 
                            2 mess 
                            () 
                            [((IntegerConstant 1 (Integer 4 [])))] 
                            (Real 8 []) 
                            () 
                            ()
                        )] 
                        () 
                        ()
                    )
                    (Return)] 
                    () 
                    Source 
                    Public 
                    Implementation 
                    () 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    [] 
                    [] 
                    .false.
                )
            
        }) 
    []
)
```
I think `[mess]` is a dependencies list.

Okay on further investigation, for the above case `asr_verify` fails because of [`@libasr/asr_verify:L91`](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/blob/main/src/libasr/asr_verify.cpp#L91). 
Here according to me `mess` is not expected as `Function`. I do not know the reason why this occurs (looking into it).

With f7538325aea203a308c841f94f69d71826b74e7e I get:
```console
$ lfortran --show-asr a.f90 --indent
(TranslationUnit 
    (SymbolTable
        1
        {
            xerror:
                (Function 
                    (SymbolTable
                        2
                        {
                            mess:
                                (Variable 
                                    2 
                                    mess 
                                    [] 
                                    Unspecified 
                                    () 
                                    () 
                                    Default 
                                    (Character 1 1 () []) 
                                    Source 
                                    Public 
                                    Required 
                                    .false.
                                )
                            
                        }) 
                    xerror 
                    [] 
                    [(Var 2 mess)] 
                    [(Print 
                        () 
                        [(ArrayItem 
                            (Var 2 mess) 
                            [(() 
                            (IntegerConstant 1 (Integer 4 [])) 
                            ())] 
                            (Character 1 1 () []) 
                            ColMajor 
                            ()
                        )] 
                        () 
                        ()
                    )
                    (Return)] 
                    () 
                    Source 
                    Public 
                    Implementation 
                    () 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    .false. 
                    [] 
                    [] 
                    .false.
                )
            
        }) 
    []
)
```

It also seems to work with the latest main d2f947eed49002391830291420be48bcb74c767b.

Here is how to reproduce:
```
$ lfortran --show-asr --implicit-typing --allow-implicit-interface a.f90 --indent 
ASR verify pass error: ASR verify: Var::m_v `mess` cannot point outside of its symbol table
 --> a.f90:1:7 - 5:10
  |
1 |          SUBROUTINE XERROR(MESS)
  |          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^...
...
  |
5 |          END
  | ...^^^^^^^^^^ failed here
```
It's a bug in `--allow-implicit-interface`, we have to debug it and fix it.

This is occurring because of line [`@src/lfortran/semantics/asr_common_visitor#L3017`](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/blob/main/src/lfortran/semantics/ast_common_visitor.h#L3017), the reason for the same is mentioned there.
Should we give a better error message here, differentiating between `mess` pointing outside of its symbol table and Var::m_v `mess` not as expected in the symbol table?

This particular bug I think can be fixed by adding a check for a string here:
```
        if (compiler_options.implicit_interface
                && ASR::is_a<ASR::Variable_t>(*v)
                && (!ASRUtils::is_array(ASRUtils::symbol_type(v)))) {
```
That is, `&& (! < is "v" a string>)`.

issue.title: Add provision to avoid `character*(*)` in creation of `implicit_interface`
[SciPy] semantic error: The LHS of assignment can only be a variable or an array reference

labels.name: SciPy
labels.description: issues related to enable LFortran to compile the entire FORTRAN codebase in SciPy

issue.body:
```fortran
      SUBROUTINE CVOUT( IFMT )

      CHARACTER          IFMT*( * )
      INTEGER            I
      CHARACTER*80       LINE
      LLL = MIN( LEN( IFMT ), 80 )
      DO 10 I = 1, LLL
         LINE( I: I ) = '-'
   10 CONTINUE

      END
```

throws the following error 

```
semantic error: The LHS of assignment can only be a variable or an array reference
 --> /home/pranavchiku/scipy/scipy/sparse/linalg/_eigen/arpack/ARPACK/UTIL/cvout2.f:8:10
  |
8 |          LINE( I: I ) = '-'
  |          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ 


Note: if any of the above error or warning messages are not clear or are lacking
context please report it to us (we consider that a bug that needs to be fixed).
```
